doc.title: Auto Monthly: Motorin'
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA/Auto Monthly Motorin August U.S. SAAR expected at 16.0mnAuto Monthly Motorin August U.S. SAAR expected at 16.0mn_2025-08-28

processing_metadata.publication: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA
processing_metadata.input_relative_path: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA

passages.text: We expect U.S. light vehicle sales in August to run at a SAAR of 16.0mn units (Bloomberg est. of 16.0mn), up from 15.1mn units last year. The numbers are expected to be released on Wednesday, September \(3^{\mathrm{rd}}\) .

IHS (S&P Global Mobility) sees global 2025 volumes \(+0.9\%\) YoY at 90.4mn units and North America 2025 volumes down \(3.3\%\) YoY to 14.9mn units. The August forecast update incorporates a blend of mostly near- term upgrades, driven by adjustments for the ongoing volatility in global trade and various regional dynamics. Notably, Greater China saw the largest upward revisions, supported by strong vehicle sales and robust export activity. North America's upgrades reflect resilient production levels, as automakers are currently absorbing tariff costs rather than passing them on to consumers in the short term.

LKQ Corp (LKQ) agreed to sell its Self Service segment to Pacific Avenue Capital Partners for enterprise value of \(\) 410\mathrm{mn}\(. The net proceeds from the sale will be used to strengthen LKQ's balance sheet through debt repayment. The transaction is expected to be completed during the fourth quarter of 2025.

Hertz (HTZ) will start selling pre- owned cars on Amazon Autos. In the deal with Amazon Autos, buyers can browse cars, complete their purchase on the website and pick up the car at locations in Dallas, Houston, Los Angeles and Seattle, the company said. It plans to expand to 45 locations around the U.S.

Carvana's (CVNA) long- term rating was upgraded by S&P to BB- from B. Long- Term Rating was upgraded by S&P to BB- from B. Outlook to positive from stable. The upgrade reflects the CVNA's sustained improvements in top line, profitability, and credit metrics. The positive outlook reflects S&P's view that it could upgrade Carvana over the next 12 months if the company continues growing sales and earnings while maintaining leverage comfortably below 3x and free operating cash flow (FOCF) to debt above \(15\%\) .

In August, the ICE BofA HY Auto index underperformed the ICE BofA BB index by 1bp and underperformed the ICE BofA B index by 8bps. The ICE BofA HY Autos index was 29bps tighter in August to 249bps. The ICE BofA BB index was 30bp tighter to 190bps, and the ICE BofA B index was 37bps tighter to 313bps.

BofA Securities does and seeks to do business with issuers covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision. Refer to important disclosures on page 19 to 21.
High Yield Credit United States Autos

Source: Bloomberg, BofA Global Research

BofA GLOBAL RESEARCH

We expect U.S. light vehicle sales in August to run at a SAAR of 16.0mn units (Bloomberg est. of 16.0mn). The numbers are expected to be released on Wednesday, September 3rd. IHS (S&P Global Mobility) sees global 2025 volumes 0.9% YoY at 90.4mn units and North America 2025 volumes down 3.3% YoY to 14mn units.
Exhibit 7: Monthly U.S. light vehicle sales – domestic & import (SAAR, millions)
The July 2025 US SAAR was 16.9mn units, with a domestic SAAR of 13.0mn units and an Import SAAR of 3.9mn units.
Source: Autodata Corp, BofA Global Research
BofA GLOBAL RESEARCH
The July 2025 US SAAR was 16.9mn units, up from 16.0mn units in July 2024.
Source: Autodata Corp, BofA Global Research, Bloomberg E-estimates

During July 2025, total light- duty vehicle sales in the U.S. were 1,406K units, up from 1,292K units a year ago. During the month, U.S. small car sales were 100K units (7.1% market share), middle- segment car sales were 78K units (5.6% market share), luxury car sales were 61K units (4.3% market share), pick- up sales were 269K units (19.2% market share), SUV sales were 177K units (12.6% market share), and CUV sales were 654K units (46.5% market share). By manufacturer, GM had 16.9% share of the U.S. market, Toyota had 15.5%, Ford had 13.4%, and Stellantis had 7.4%.
Exhibit 9: U.S. light vehicle segments ('000s)
Source: Autodata Corp
Exhibit 10: U.S. light vehicle segments ('000s)
Source: Autodata Corp
In July 2025, SUV share decreased 110bps YoY to 12.6%.
Source: Autodata Corp
Exhibit 12: U.S. light vehicle market share ('000s) In July 2025, GM and Toyota had the highest US market share at \(16.9\%\) and \(15.5\%\) , respectively.
Source: Autodata Corp
Exhibit 13: July 2025 US Sales, % Change YoY US industry sales increased 4.7% YoY in July.
Source: Motor Intelligence
Exhibit 14: July 2025 U.S. Market Share GM led with \(16.9\%\) .
Source: Motor Intelligence

In July, passenger car registrations in Europe were 986K, up 2.7% YoY. Ford had 3.6%market share, up from 3.4% YoY. STLA had 15.3% market share, down from 15.9% YoY.GM exited the European business in August 2017 with the sale of its European assets to PSA.
**Exhibit 15: European provisional passenger car registrations ('000s)**
VW Group had 307k registrations in July 2025, the most of all OEMs in the region.
BofA GLOBAL RESEARCH
In July, China auto sales, including passenger and commercial automobiles, were 2,593k.
Exhibit 16: China monthly auto sales ('000s) China auto sales were up \(14.6\%\) YoY in July 2025.

Light vehiclesIHS forecasts North America 2025 light vehicle production to be \(14.9\mathrm{mn}\) units, down \(3.3\%\) YoY from 2024 and down from the \(16.3\mathrm{mn}\) units produced in 2019. For commercial trucks, July North American Class 8 net orders were \(13.2\mathrm{k}\) down \(2\%\) YoY. ACT expects North American Class 8 production of \(253.4\mathrm{k}\) in 2025, down \(24\%\) YoY. July North American Class 5- 7 net orders were \(13.2\mathrm{k}\) down \(16\%\) YoY. ACT expects North American Class 5- 7 production of \(212.0\mathrm{k}\) in 2025, down \(24\%\) YoY.
Exhibit 17: North American Production OutlookIHS forecasts North America production bouncing back to pre-covid levels in 2025.
BofA GLOBAL RESEARCH
Exhibit 18:Big 3 Actual and Scheduled Production
Source: IHS, company reports. E=estimates
GM car production is estimated at 42k units in 2025 and 43k units in 2026.

At the end of July, total U.S. days supply at dealers was 47 days, below the ten- year average of 49 days and above the 5- year average of 36 days. GM days supply was 57 days. Ford days supply was 65 days. Stellantis days supply was 65 days.
Exhibit 27: Days supply (days) & unit stock ('000s) GM unit stock 517k, Ford 473k, and Stellantis 261k.
July 2025Days SupplyUnit StockGMCar6210Truck57508Total57517FordCar8314Truck65460Total65473StellantisCar1185Truck65257Total65261
Source: Autodata Corp
Exhibit 28: Inventory supply (days) Inventories are moving closer to historical levels.
Source: Autodata Corp
BofA GLOBAL RESEARCH
Exhibit 29: Historical industry inventory supply (days) Industry inventory supply (days) is steadily increasing.
Source: Autodata Corp
Exhibit 30:Big 3 unit stock ('000s) Unit stock in July.
Exhibit 30:Big 3 unit stock ('000s) Unit stock in July.
Source: Autodata Corp

Average industry promotions up \(+4.6\%\) YoYIn July, average industry promotions and incentives were \(3,553 per vehicle, up 4.6\%\) YoY. Average GM promotions and incentives per vehicle were down \(3.4\%\) YoY. Average Ford promotions and incentives per vehicle were down \(3.4\%\) YoY. Average Stallantis promotions and incentives per vehicle increased \(40.5\%\) YoY. Average Asian promotions and incentives per vehicle increased \(1.7\%\) YoY. Average European promotions and incentives per vehicle decreased \(13.6\%\) YoY.
Exhibit 31: July Promotion Spending per Unit OEMs, Regions, and Industry. Stellantis highest at \$4,583.
Source: Autodata Corp
Exhibit 32: July Promotion Spending per Unit (YoY % change) OEMs, Regions, and Industry. Stellantis increased the most at \(+40.5\%\)
Source: Autodata Corp
Exhibit 33: Industry averages for U.S. light vehicle promotion spending per unit Industry averages for U.S. light vehicle promotion spending per unit have been recovering to normal levels.
Source: Autodata Corp

In July, the end- of- month Manheim Index for used vehicle prices was 207.4, up \(2.9\%\) YoY and down \(0.5\%\) MoM. In July, the Black Book Used Vehicle Retention Index was 146.5, an increase of \(1.0\%\) YoY and a decrease of \(1.1\%\) MoM.
Manheim Used Vehicle Index increased \(2.9\%\) YoY.
Source: Manheim Used Vehicle Index
Black Book Used Vehicle Retention Index increased \(1.0\%\) YoY.
Source: Black Book Used Vehicle Retention Index
BofA GLOBAL RESEARCH
Manheim Used Vehicle Index was \(+2.9\%\) YoY in July.
